data.title: Excitement builds for the season at Packers Family Night
data.meta_description: There was a full house at Lambeau Field for the annual practice.
data.text:
GREEN BAY, Wis. â Thereâs a good chance Ben Jacobi will be wearing the same green and gold striped overalls in January.

He was getting a start to the 2024 season with a group of adults and kids in high 80-degree weather at the Green Bay Packers Family Night at Lambeau Field Saturday.

âItâs not football weather. Football weather is zero and snow. But we do it every year,â the Pewaukee resident said. âWeâve been doing it probably eight, 10 years. Itâs just something we do every year, whether itâs hot, raining, whatever.â

The scrimmage in front of a sold-out Lambeau Field offered fans an experience similar to game day with giveaways, music and post-practice fireworks.

âThere are a lot of kids in the group and itâs a cheap way to get them here, inside Lambeau, for the history and all that stuff,â Jacobi said.

While this is a years-long tradition for some fans, for others, such as Kayla Terriquez and her family, Saturday night was something new.

âThis is our first time coming out to family night. Weâve been meaning to come for several years,â said Terriquez who lives in Germantown. âThe kids are finally old enough where I think they will enjoy it and be able to stay up late enough to enjoy all the festivities.â

The night offered a mix of football and entertainment for $10 a ticket. Saturday night was a sellout.

Anthony Robertson of Daggett, Michigan, has been coming for years.

âThey do so much here at Family Night and itâs affordable. We were able to get five tickets for Lambeau for a reasonable price,â he said. âThey be having some outdoor events to keep the kids enticed and everything. I just assume a full day of fun.â

Unlike the rest of the season, Jacobi said he wasnât too sure just how much football he was going to be able to watch Saturday night.

âIâll be watching kids,â he said with a laugh.

Lucky for him, thereâs a long season that follows Family Night.
